1.title: The Royal Borough of Windsor and Maidenhead, Including Eton College
1.plot: Documentary, narrated by Hugh Bonneville, which offers an exclusive glimpse into the world of official suppliers to the royal family. The programme shines a light on the talented craftsmen and women who all hold warrants as official suppliers to the royal family. From tailors to cheese makers, medal crafters to wine suppliers, and cobblers to carriage makers, their skills and craftsmanship have placed them in an exclusive group who have the right to display a royal coat of arms. imdb.plot outline: This documentary, narrated by Hugh Bonneville, offers an exclusive glimpse into the world of official suppliers to the royal family. The programme shines a light on the talented craftsmen and women who all hold warrants as official suppliers to the royal family. From tailors to cheese makers, medal crafters to wine suppliers, and cobblers to carriage makers, their skills and craftsmanship have placed them in an exclusive group who have the right to display a royal coat of arms. Many of the warrant holders have captivating stories and absorbing anecdotes about their years of royal service. They share their memories and experiences with us to provide a real flavour of what it means to be a royal supplier. Including contributions from royal correspondents, authors and historians.
imdb.title: By Royal Appointment
plot: This documentary, narrated by Hugh Bonneville, offers an exclusive glimpse into the world of official suppliers to the royal family. The programme shines a light on the talented craftsmen and women who all hold warrants as official suppliers to the royal family. From tailors to cheese makers, medal crafters to wine suppliers, and cobblers to carriage makers, their skills and craftsmanship have placed them in an exclusive group who have the right to display a royal coat of arms. Many of the warrant holders have captivating stories and absorbing anecdotes about their years of royal service. They share their memories and experiences with us to provide a real flavour of what it means to be a royal supplier. Including contributions from royal correspondents, authors and historians.
